newsitem.title: USA: Dakota Mining in N.E. Nevada gold venture.
newsitem.headline: Dakota Mining in N.E. Nevada gold venture.

text.p: Dakota Mining Corp said on Friday that it and Neil & Associates Inc had entered into an agreement to jointly explore for gold in northeastern Nevada.
Dakota said it can maintain a 50 percent participating interest in the joint venture by paying $50,000 to Neil and funding 50 percent of all exploration expenditures.

Initially, Neil will manage all exploration activities, but Dakota may elect to assume managerial responsibility for subsequent development after having contributed $125,000 to the joint venture exploration account, Dakota said.

The joint venture will investigate three prior-producing gold properties in northern Elko County that contain geochemical anomalies similar to the gold-antimony-tungsten deposits found in the Yellow Pine mining district of central Idaho.
Work on the three prospects will consist of geochemical sampling, geological mapping and drill testing, for which the joint venture has agreed to spend $140,000 for the balance of 1996.
In addition to exploring these targets, the venture will investigate other gold prospects with similar gold signatures within a 200 square mile surrounding area.
